info.long_name: Primary care access by count
info.short_description: Count of primary care physicians based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of primary care physicians based on provider locations. Address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: There are {primacare_cnt} primary care physicians in {region_name}
info.name: WebMD Physician Directory

info.long_name: Primary care access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of primary care physician accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Primary care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of physicians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for physicians (population served by physicians). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The primary care accessibility score for {region_name}  is  {primacare_e2sfca}
info.name: WebMD Physician Directory
info.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

info.long_name: Dental care access by count
info.short_description: Count of dentists based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of dentists based on provider locations. Address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: There are {dent_cnt} densits in {region_name}
info.name: SafeGraph Core

info.long_name: Dental care access score (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of dental care accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Dental care access score based on 2-step ehanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The dental care access score for {region_name} is {dent_e2sfca}
info.name: SafeGraph Core
info.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

info.long_name: OBGYN care acess by count
info.short_description: Count of OBGYNs based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of OBGYN care providers based on provider locations. Address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: There are {obgyn_cnt}  OBGYNs in {region_name}
info.name: WebMD Physician Directory

info.long_name: OBGYN care access score (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of OBGYN care accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: OBGYN care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of OBGYNs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for OBGYNs (population served by OBGYNs). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online physician directory.
info.statement: The OBGYN access score for {region_name}  is {obgyn_e2sfca}
info.name: WebMD Physician Directory
info.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

info.long_name: Percent of population without health insurance
info.short_description: Percent of the population self-reported to not be currently covered by any type of health insurance or health coverage plan
info.long_description: Percent of the population self-reported to not be currently covered by any type of health insurance or health coverage plan. This data comes from Question 16 of the Person section of the American Community Survey.
info.statement: {no_hlth_ins_pct} percent of the population has no health insurance in  {region_name}
info.name: American Community Survey

info.long_name: Preventable hospital stays per 100,000 Medicare enrollees
info.short_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees
info.long_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees. Ambulatory care refers to diagnoses that are usually treatable in outpatient settings. This data is based on Medicare claims and comes from County Health Rankings.
info.statement: {prevent_hosp_rate} percent of the hospitalizations in {region_name}  were preventable (due to conditions usually treated in outpatient settings)
info.name: County Health Rankings

info.long_name: Access to day care by count
info.short_description: Count of day cares based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of day cares based on provider locations. Address data was collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.  Day care capacity count
info.statement: There are {daycare_cnt} daycares in {region_name}
info.name: Virginia Department of Social Services

info.long_name: Day care access score (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care accessibility based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Primary care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data was collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. Demand = 0-12 years, supply = day care capacity
info.statement: The daycare accessibility score for {region_name} is  {daycare_norm_3sfca}
info.name: Virginia Department of Social Services
info.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

info.long_name: Digitial equity index
info.statement: The digital equity index for {region_name} is {norm_dei}
info.citations: Gallardo, Robert (2020)

info.long_name: Percent of population with broadband
info.statement: {perc_w_broadband} percent of the population in {region_name} has a broadband connection
info.name: American Community Survey

info.short_name: Population with cable, fiber optic, or DSL
info.long_name: Percent of population with a high speed internet service (cable, fiber optic, or DSL)
info.statement: {perc_w_cable_fiber_DSL} percent of the population in {region_name} has a cable fiber or DSL internet connection
info.name: American Community Survey

info.long_name: Average download speed (MB/s)
info.statement: The average download speed for internet connections in {region_name} is {download} MB/s
info.name: Ookla

info.long_name: Median percent of 3rd grade population passing reading test
info.statement: The median percent of 3rd graders with passing reading scores in {region_name} is {median_read_pass_rate} percent
info.name: Virginia Department of Education

info.long_name: Health literacy estimate
info.name: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey; American Community Survey
info.citations: Stavitz et al. (2020); Liang and Branch (2017)

info.long_name: 2 year college access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of 2-year college accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Demand = whole population, supply = total number of students enrolled in a year (graduate and undergraduate)
info.name: National Center for Education Statistics
info.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

info.long_name: Trade school access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of trade school accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Demand = whole population, supply = total number of students enrolled in a year ( undergraduate)
info.name: National Center for Education Statistics
info.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

info.long_name: Percent  of population with post-high school education
info.name: American Community Survey

info.name: Virginia Department of Social Services

info.name: National Center for Education Statistics

info.long_name: Trade school access by median drive time to the five closest schools in minutes
